question.title: How PDFBox 2.0.x handles signature field in PDF which supports accessibility?
question.body:
I have a PDF form document which supports accessibility. I need to put a signature in one of the field as like below screeshot.

Signature Field

I use Apache PDFBox 2.0.x to get the field's position and sign the name in this field by below sample code. But the signature signed by below code could not be read by screen reader.

My question is how to make this signature (My Name) in this field be readable and in the correct order (read after Last Name (Family Name)) by PDFBox API?

PDPage fieldPage = document.getPage(pageNumber);
try (PDPageContentStream contentStream = new PDPageContentStream(document, fieldPage, AppendMode.APPEND, true, true)) {
      contentStream.addRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
      contentStream.fill();
      contentStream.setNonStrokingColor(Color.DARK_GRAY);
      contentStream.beginText();
      contentStream.setFont(unicodeFont, 9);
      contentStream.setLeading(10f);
      contentStream.newLineAtOffset(left + 13, bottom + 12); 
      contentStream.showText("My Name");
      contentStream.endText();
}

Thanks a lot for the help!

I tried below code, looks like the content can be read, but the reading order is not correct. The signature will be read at the end of all elements.

COSDictionary currentMarkedContentDictionary = new COSDictionary();
      currentMarkedContentDictionary.setInt(COSName.MCID, 0);
contentStream.beginMarkedContent(COSName.P, PDPropertyList.create(currentMarkedContentDictionary));
contentStream.endMarkedContent();

I expect the signature can be read after the field content, i.e firstly read "Last Name (Family Name)", then read "My Name".
